text: Cliff Green OAM (6 December 1934 â€“ 4 December 2020) was an Australian screenwriter. He was best known for his work in Picnic at Hanging Rock (1975). In 2009, he was awarded the Order of Australia Medal. == Life and career == He was born in Melbourne. He worked as a school teacher. His screenplay for the 1990 TV movie, Boy Soldiers, was the first Australian drama to receive an Emmy nomination. Green died on 4 December 2020, aged 85.Vale Cliff Green, esteemed screenwriter ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Australian screenwriters Category:Writers from Melbourne
title: Cliff Green
